message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.DC, cs.CY, cs.SE 

The paper discusses the security and privacy concerns in managing and sharing Electronic Medical Records (EMR) and proposes a distributed data sharing scheme that applies the security benefits of blockchain. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). The paper also mentions the use of a distributed storage system, which is a characteristic of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the selective sharing of medical records among staff members belonging to different levels of a hierarchical institution, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of Databases (cs.DB). The paper also mentions the use of smart contracts, which is a characteristic of Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a novel distributed data sharing scheme, which suggests that it may belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
